column4: Macroeconomist, famous for working with business cycles, and a member of Bloomsbury Group.
Financial analyst, a friend of Ben Graham.
Father of value investor, began to quantify with things such as PE and PB.
Pioneer of growth investing. Famous for the book 'Common Stocks and Uncommon Profits' -book.
Nobel Prize-winning economist, famous of the efficient frontier.
The founder, retired CEO of The Vanguard, famous of the book 'Common Sense on Mutual Funds' -- pioneer of low-cost investing.
Legendary investor and particularly a businessman.
Economist: famous of random walk and regarded as the father of efficient market hypothesis.
Businessman and investor with some convergences with Warren Buffett.
John Bogle founds The Vanguard Group, specializing in low-cost indexed products.
Informal forum in Morningstar later transformed to Bogleheads.org, popular passive low-cost investing site.
